channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: My Flip MUST Check These 5 Boxes—or I’m Walking Away From the Deal
item.description: If something about the deal doesn't make financial sense, I'm not buying.

item.title: Fisker collapsed under the weight of its founder’s promises
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch’s Week in Review — TechCrunch’s newsletter recapping the week’s biggest news. Want it in your inbox every Saturday? Sign up here. Over the past eight years, famed vehicle designer Henrik Fisker suggested his EV startup would deliver on a lot of promises, but none came true. As Fisker looks for an […] © 2024 TechCrunch. item.title: How Abortion’s Legal Landscape Post-Roe is Causing Fear and Confusion
item.description: We spoke with seven reproductive rights organizations — here’s what we found.

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: No, Cash is Not King—You Can Do Way More and Way Better With Financing
item.description: You hear it all the time on BiggerPockets Forums, podcasts, local meetups, from gurus, etc. It must be true if everyone says it is: “Cash is king.” The idea is […]

item.title: WTF is AI?
item.description: What is AI? We've put together this non-technical guide to give anyone a fighting chance to understand how and why today's AI works. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: I Recorded a Whole Hip-Hop Album on a Death Row Telephone
item.description: In this new book excerpt, incarcerated rapper Alim “RRome Alone” Braxton describes his early attempts to record vocals over a phone in the dayroom.

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: BiggerNews: 6 Rules for Real Estate Investing in 2024
item.description: Real estate investing in 2024 isn’t as easy as a few years ago. When interest rates are low, housing inventory is high, the economy is booming, and everyone’s happy, real […]

item.title: President Biden vetoes crypto custody bill
item.description: President Joe Biden has vetoed H.J.Res. 109, a congressional resolution that would have overturned the Securities and Exchange Commission’s current approach to banks and crypto. Specifically, the resolution targeted the SEC’s Staff Accounting Bulletin 121, which presents guidance around how banks can handle customers’ crypto assets — in effect, they must treat those assets as […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Legal Doctrine That Shields Police From Many Lawsuits May Be Losing Support
item.description: A federal judge in Mississippi joined other courts in recently rejecting police arguments that qualified immunity protected their actions.

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: Rookie Reply: How to Invest in Real Estate While Working 9-5
item.description: If real estate investing was easy, everyone would be doing it! The truth is that, despite the financial freedom and flexibility it offers, investing is hard work. And it’s even […]

item.title: Industries may be ready for humanoid robots, but are the robots ready for them?
item.description: How large a role humanoids will play in that ecosystem is, perhaps, the biggest question on everyone’s mind at the moment. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Out of the Blue: The Rise and Fall of a Black Cop
item.description: After Cleveland officer Vincent Montague shot a Black man, he got promoted. Then he allied with Black Lives Matter, and his life went off the rails.

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: What Even We Didn’t Know About “Protecting” Our Wealth
item.description: Are you working towards FIRE or building a financial legacy? Then DON’T skip this episode! What’s the point of creating generational wealth if it will be lost after you’re gone? […]

item.title: VCs are selling shares of hot AI companies like Anthropic and xAI to small investors in a wild SPV market
item.description: VCs are clamoring to invest in hot AI companies, willing to pay exorbitant share prices for coveted spots on their cap tables. Even so, most aren’t able to get into such deals at all. Yet, small, unknown investors, including family offices and high-net-worth individuals, have found their own way to get shares of the hottest […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Marshall Project Wins Prestigious Robert F. Kennedy Journalism Award for Criminal Justice
item.description: The award recognizes our 2023 investigation exposing lax prison discipline for abusive guards in New York state prisons.

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.
